issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: FileSystemTimelineReader/Writer uses unix-specific default storage path

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: {{TestDistributedShell.checkTimelineV2()}} uses the default (hard-coded) storage root directory. This is brittle against concurrent tests. We should use a unique storage directory for the unit tests.
fields.summary: TestDistributedShell.checkTimelineV2() may fail for concurrent tests

comments.body:
Posted patch v.1.

Switched to using a test-specific storage directory. I realize that the {{FileSystemTimelineWriterImpl}} default value should be handled separately. I'll file a separate JIRA.

Changes LGTM. Will commit it later today.
Did not know about TemporaryFolder. Seems like a good rule to use.

Committed the latest patch to trunk.
Thanks [~sjlee0] for your contribution. And thanks [~jrottinghuis] for the review.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10079 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10079/])
